content.raw: I would be in favor of that, but based on some experiments, I found that `CMAKE_DL_LIBS` was a blank variable on both Ubuntu and Windows. If there's something that can be called to reliably give it a value, I would definitely consider using it. However, we would also need it to be compatible on Windows (unless we just decide to handle Windows separately, at which point it doesn't seem useful to use `CMAKE_DL_LIBS`).

If there's something that can be called to reliably give it a value, I would definitely consider using it.
